data.title: Sell Vehicles Via Service Depot...
data.body:
The idea of being able to sell certain vehicles via service depot; like in the original RA would be a sensible implementation.

Say you don't want a vehicle or built one to many of a unit. Select said vehicle: command move unit to the Service Depot: sell vehicle with "Sell" cursor.

data.title: Spies can be detected by Hinds even when disguised
data.body: Just what the title says. Can't think why this would be.

data.title: Hold queue orders until you are ready
data.body:
When you hold "shift" (default) to start a queue order the unit will start your first order immediately instead of waiting till you let go of the "shift". If you want the unit to start the queue order immediately you can always let go of the shift after one or two orders before reholding it again to queue more orders.

Here you see an example of the units waiting til you are ready for them to move and let go of the queue order button.
![Illustration of waypoints](http://i.imgur.com/oF5ICXE.jpg)

data.title: Medic cannot heal through concrete wall; tries anyway
data.body: Medics appear unable to heal through a concrete wall, but the sound effect is given when the medic is in range and the attempt is made with no effect. Don't know whether that should be resolved by allowing medic to heal through wall or by stopping him from trying. Current release-20161019.

data.title: Upgrades overhaul part 3: Timed, external, and stacked conditions.
data.body:
The third step towards #12380.  Depends on #12396, #12381.

This PR does three major things:
* Reimplement timed conditions in a serialization-friendly way for the future.
* Externally granted conditions must be explicitly whitelisted for each actor type on the `UpgradeManager`.  This is required to accurately lint the conditions.
* Stacked condition bonuses can be defined on the `UpgradeManager`, and give a concise way to 
deal with stacking effects mainly from external sources.

I've ported the three easy external granters to the new setup. Lua and UAN will get their own PRs next, so remain shimmed for now.

The last commit demonstrates condition stacking by changing the color of the iron curtain to green then blue with 2 then 3 stacked applications.

data.title: Shrink TD weapon yamls by using inheritance
data.body:
The primary motivation isn't just yaml size, but also to make it easier to change some values across the board more easily.

If this gets a positive response and merged, I'll create similar PRs for the other 3 mods.

data.title: [idea] add support long .wav sound files.
data.body:
When I try to add .wav music over 10 minutes, and start play it in game, - game is crach:

> Exception of type `System.IO.EndOfStreamException`: Attempted to read past the end of the stream.

data.title: Single archive download containing binaries for multiple OS
data.body:
[OpenArena](http://openarena.ws/download.php) and [Xonotic](http://xonotic.org/) provide a single download for Windows, macOS and Linux. A single archive contains  both i386 and amd64 binaries for these operating systems. This makes it very easy to share the game and ensure everybody is using the same version, e.g. at LAN parties. The players then only have to drop their C&C data files into the extracted archive and can start playing.

It would be nice if OpenRA would also provide a single archive for download with binaries for multiple operating systems.

Seems to crash a few moments after the GPS satellite goes up.

Produces the same exception logs:

data.title: Can not create OpenGL context. (Error: Invalid window)
data.body: Can not open game on ubuntu 15.04

data.title: Capture can't be done by a group of engineers
data.body:
If a group of engineers is sent to capture a building, only 1 will capture, the others will stay inactive.

_Situation I've came across : capturing enemy expansion, the only unit who could kill my engy was an ore truck. The enemy MCV being captured, no reinforcements could be brought (barracks, defence). And two engies at opposite sides of the MCV could have finished the work. 
But my first engy was crushed, so the second one had to start the capture all over again. Resulting in not being able to cap it, so I destroyed it._

Shouldn't multiple engineers be able to pass the relay ? 

Also, a subsequent idea would be to make the capture faster, at a certain rate (for instance : +50% faster per engy). Engies could then become a more useful unit on the field.

data.title: Upgrades overhaul part2: GrantCondition and Carryall fixes.
data.body:
This implements the `GrantCondition` trait that was outlined (as `ConditionCombiner`) in #12380.

This also ports the carryall traits over to the new conditions code, and works around the glitches with tick tanks and mobile sensor arrays.

Depends on #12381.

data.title: Vehicles stopping before the target location
data.body:
When issuing a move order to a group of similar vehicles in a packed group, it seems that the ones in the back stop at some point, and don't continue to the target location.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XU06HAaFnrM

It seems to be happening on short distances, or at the end of a long path. 

I didn't check if it happens with other configs (infantry in the front and vehicles in the back, slow vehicles front and fast behind, ...)

data.title: Can't cross 2 out of 4 bridges on a non-official own map
data.body:
Howdy,

I am not sure if this a bug with the engine or with my map, but unfortunately I cannot figure this out myself. I created a map with 4 destroyed bridges that are meant to be repaired at will. The map doesn't contain any custom rules.

For some reason, when I repair my 2 bridges at the top-right corner, I can't cross them. Something blocks the way, even though visually they look good.

Broken state | Repaired state
-- | ---

Map link: http://resource.openra.net/maps/17310/

data.title: Sound::LoadSound does not use `loaders` parameter
The AA & AG weapon reload delays are not linked together.
data.body:
The Flak truck,  Rocket soldier, Destroyer, Missile submarine, and Longbow are all capable of shooting between their AA & AG weapons without any delay. Aesthetically speaking it would look much better if units weren't firing twice immediately. -- Changing this may have balance implications worth discussing for units with relatively slow reload delays.

One way this can be fixed (excluding the longbow) is by utilizing the AmmoPool trait. By moving the reload delays from the weapons themselves to a unit's AmmoPool:, you're able to adjust a shared reload delay.

e.g.

OpenRA\mods\ra\rules\vehicles.yaml
FTRK:
+AmmoPool:
++Name: Flak Cannon
++Ammo: 1
++SelfReloadDelay: 10
++PipCount: 0
++ReloadCount: 1
++SelfReloads: True
+Armament@AA:
++AmmoPoolName: Flak Cannon
+Armament@AG:
++AmmoPoolName: Flak Cannon

OpenRA\mods\ra\weapons\smallcaliber.yaml
FLAK-23-AA:
+-ReloadDelay:
FLAK-23-AG:
+-ReloadDelay:

OpenRA\mods\ra\rules\infantry.yaml
E3:
+AmmoPool:
++Name: Rocket
++Ammo: 1
++SelfReloadDelay: 50
++PipCount: 0
++ReloadCount: 1
++SelfReloads: True
+Armament@PRIMARY:
++AmmoPoolName: Rocket
+Armament@SECONDARY:
++AmmoPoolName: Rocket

OpenRA\mods\ra\weapons\missiles.yaml
Dragon:
+-ReloadDelay:

RedEye:
+-ReloadDelay:

Stinger:
+-ReloadDelay:

StingerAA:
+-ReloadDelay:

SubMissile:
+-ReloadDelay:

OpenRA\mods\ra\rules\ships.yaml
DD:
+AmmoPool:
++Name: Stinger
++Ammo: 2
++SelfReloadDelay: 60
++PipCount: 0
++ReloadCount: 2
++SelfReloads: True
+Armament@PRIMARY:
++AmmoPoolName: Stinger
+Armament@TERTIARY:
++AmmoPoolName: Stinger

MSUB:
+AmmoPool:
+Name: SubMissile
++Ammo: 2
++SelfReloadDelay: 300
++PipCount: 0
++ReloadCount: 2
++SelfReloads: True
+Armament@PRIMARY:
++AmmoPoolName: SubMissile
+Armament@SECONDARY:
++AmmoPoolName: SubMissile


AmmoPool Traits:
https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/wiki/Traits#ammopool

Armament Traits:
https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/wiki/Traits#armament

data.title: System.DllNotFoundException: soft_oal.dll [Arch Linux]
data.body:
I got the following error message with the latest OpenRA git version on Arch Linux, while launching the game:

_.openra/Logs/Graphics.log_

```
System.DllNotFoundException: soft_oal.dll
  at (wrapper managed-to-native) OpenAL.ALC10:alcOpenDevice (string)
  at OpenRA.Platforms.Default.OpenAlSoundEngine..ctor (System.String deviceName) [0x0003d] in <64233f2ae9704f709bb42ee9b7add88c>:0 
  at OpenRA.Platforms.Default.DefaultPlatform.CreateSound (System.String device) [0x00001] in <64233f2ae9704f709bb42ee9b7add88c>:0 
  at OpenRA.Sound..ctor (OpenRA.IPlatform platform, OpenRA.SoundSettings soundSettings) [0x0001d] in <b993ba910e244155af3ff58a871c0e64>:0 
  at OpenRA.Game.Initialize (OpenRA.Arguments args) [0x001c5] in <b993ba910e244155af3ff58a871c0e64>:0 
System.DllNotFoundException: soft_oal.dll
  at (wrapper managed-to-native) OpenAL.ALC10:alcOpenDevice (string)
  at OpenRA.Platforms.Default.OpenAlSoundEngine..ctor (System.String deviceName) [0x0003d] in <64233f2ae9704f709bb42ee9b7add88c>:0 
  at OpenRA.Platforms.Default.DefaultPlatform.CreateSound (System.String device) [0x00001] in <64233f2ae9704f709bb42ee9b7add88c>:0 
  at OpenRA.Sound..ctor (OpenRA.IPlatform platform, OpenRA.SoundSettings soundSettings) [0x0001d] in <b993ba910e244155af3ff58a871c0e64>:0 
  at OpenRA.Game.Initialize (OpenRA.Arguments args) [0x001c5] in <b993ba910e244155af3ff58a871c0e64>:0 
```

I can't access even to the loading/modchooser screen. When I launch the game, it crashes immediately without opening the main game window. To exclude possibility the crash has something to do with a specific mod to be loaded during the launch, I changed it to another in .openra/settings.yaml.
 
I hardly can pinpoint the issue though the message is clear: "Dll not found" (soft_oal.dll), and indicates this has something to do with openal (?). I upgraded my OpenAL package version to 1.17.2 and re-compiled the game just to make sure this hasn't anything to do with too old openal package version on my system.
 
I assume the issue affects only me. I didn't get the message on openSUSE, Windows or Ubuntu 16.04 LTS after successful compilations. This leads to my main question which is: What (packages, dll's, codelines...) should I look for to narrow down the issue on my system? Which things/packages/configuration should I re-check or upgrade to fix this? Does it have something to do with NuGet downloads during complation? (as you can assume: yes, I'm kinda lost here)

Any help is appreciated. Thank you!

data.title: Beacons ideas : multiple beacons / spectator to all
data.body:
Some inspiration from here : #10390

Could add the following ideas : 
- being able to place multiple beacons (ex : different spots being attacked / drawing a "route to follow" / ... )
- possibility for specs to place beacons for players : especially to help newbies learn the game. Maybe have two modes : spec-only, and spec to all.

data.title: Replace the "Debug" prefix by "Battlefield Control" for ingame chat messages
data.body: I also unhardcode the messages inside the `ConquestVictoryConditions` and `StrategicVictoryConditions` traits. Each map can now define custom messages (with a custom announcer "prefix" and color).

data.title: Game crashes for no apparent reason
data.body:
Hi, OpenRA occasionally crashes while playing multiplayer games for no apparent reason. First, the game completely freezes for all players, then after a couple of seconds I see the Windows 10 blue "wait" circle (http://fud.community.services.support.microsoft.com/Fud/FileDownloadHandler.ashx?fid=25890fba-fd6c-4700-a2eb-cca90d5142b9). After that the game either crashes and closes or it resumes. If it resumes it will say that I have a connection problem and the other players are usually angry at me. If it doesn't resume it crashes completely, says "Openra has encountered a fatal error..etc" and refers me to the Logs folder.

I am on Windows 10. I did a fresh install of the OS just yesterday in an attempt to rule our any problem at the OS level or other applications interfering. So it is basically a clean OS with only some development tools like GIT and Maven installed. Nothing that should interfere with OpenRA.



I inspected the Logs directory. There is no exception log there and the only logs that contain data are debug.log, perf.log and server.log. Debug.log and perf.log don't contain anything out of the ordinary. No errors or warning messages or stack trace. Server.log has only one line that reads "Order lag is now 3 frames.", but that line was written 9 minutes before the game crashed, so I don't think it is related.

I guess my connection would be the primary suspect, but it is a 50mbit fiber connection that works fine in other applications I use, so I'd be surprised if that is the issue, but I cannot rule it out either.

Any ideas here what could be wrong? I realize it is little to go by for analyzing a software problem. I am a developer myself. I was hoping to get something more useful from the logs...

data.title: [idea] Add sprite rotation in RenderSprites trait.
data.body: ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11130958/20279935/b7667a46-aad4-11e6-809d-65b170188989.png)

data.title: Upgrades overhaul part 1: EnabledCondition
data.body:
This is the second step towards #12380 (after #12378, which this depends on).

`EnableCondition` is implemented in parallel to the old code for all of our upgrade consumers, assuming / forcing level 0 → false, level >= 1 → true.  I have ported TS over to the new system as an example / testcase (omitting upgrade rules so that this doesn't affect other mods).

I'm looking for suggestions on a better name for `EnableCondition`, because this is ambiguous (could mean that the trait is enabled on this condition, or that the trait grants the condition).
